thread.title: Beautiful weekend expected across Charlotte Metro following rainy, foggy evening
thread.title_full: Beautiful weekend expected across Charlotte Metro following rainy, foggy evening

author: @WBTV_News
title: Beautiful weekend expected across Charlotte Metro following rainy, foggy evening
text:
Beautiful weekend expected across Charlotte Metro following rainy, foggy evening
Dry weather quickly returns
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (WBTV) - As a cold front continues to move east, more light to moderate rainfall and patchy fog can be expected across the Carolinas through tonight.
Rain will continue off-and-on throughout the day along with the possibility of a few rumbles of thunder. Highs will top out in the 40s and 50s and up to an inch of rainfall will be possible. Showers will linger for tonight and become scattered during the overnight; expect lows in the 40s.
Weekend outlook
Quiet and dry weather will quickly return on Friday and the weekend. Friday and Saturday are on track to be mostly sunny and pleasant with highs in the mid to upper 50s.
Warmer weather can be expected on Sunday with highs in the lower 60s under mostly sunny skies.
Monday and Tuesday will be mostly sunny to partly cloudy with highs in the 50s.
Forecast at a glance
- First Alert Rest of Today: Rain likely, thunder possible
- Friday: Becoming mostly sunny
- Weekend Outlook: Mostly sunny, warm
Download the free WBTV Weather app on your mobile device to receive weather alerts and get your latest WBTV weather forecast on the go. You can also get the latest weather forecast on Roku and Amazon Fireâ€™s WBTV app.
Have a great day!
Elissia
